alert.note: Alert for Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 10:15AM CST until March 06 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Georgetown affecting White, Prairie and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Georgetown. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Hurricane Lake Wildlife Management Area and Raft Creek Bottoms inundated. Roads in the bottoms are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 21.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Crest Time Date White River Georgetown 21.0 20.7 Tue 9 AM 21.0 21.0 21.0 21.0 6 AM 3/02 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
